Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a 256 bit random number between house and player

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you can generate the gameplay from the 256bits,then you can do it

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Can I get this number from RPC?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i thought I made an RPC that displays the RNG

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe I didnt

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but its there in the code

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: if we can get it to generate a number between a certain range that would be amazing, we can add many more games to our dapp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is generating a 256 bit hash, which you can extract many numbers from

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: especially if you make a hashchain out of it

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: a rpc call would be heaven that prints this number out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, ok, after the dicebet is responded to, but the current code will process it as a normal dicebet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the issue is that each games rules needs to be put into the consensus to enforce payouts for a specific game

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so for each supported game, i would need to know the exact gamerules and then can make an rpc call that is the equivalent for dicebet for that game

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: So to shuffle a deck of cards, allocate a hash to each card in array of cards[52] then sort alphanumerical from the hashchain, using 256bit number as the seed?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Ace spade = cards[0] which is hash(256bitRNG)
2 spade = cards[1] = hash(cards[0])
....
sort.

Content: it depends on the type of numbers needed what the best way is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and how they are used

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @dogracer dealer posts a hash of entropy in an "entropy tx", bettor selects an "entropy tx" to bet against, bets against it, dealer must then reveal this entropy within the "timeout window" or the bet defaults to win
